title: Icthlarin's Little Helper/Quick guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: Note: If you need to leave Sophanem at any point during the quest, there is a hole you can crawl through on the eastern wall. To get back in, enter the rocks on the east side of the Wanderer's tent. There is a bank in Nardah if needed.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Icthlarin's Little Helper/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point North-east of the entrance to Sophanem. Speak to the Wanderer.
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionIn the deep south of the desert, unrest is brewing... The cities of the Menaphites have barred their gates to all. An unsettling desert wanderer may know of a secret entrance though, to Sophanem - the city of the dead. Will you become Icthlarin's Little Helper by entering? Enter into a titanic struggle for the soul of the high priest of Icthlarin in a land where the cat is top dog.
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • Completion of Gertrude's Cat
  • The ability to defeat a level 91 monster.
Items required
  • Regular or overgrown cat, hellcat or kitten. No food is required as the kitten can stay in your inventory for the most part, or automatically go in/out of your inventory.
  • Tinderbox
  • Willow log
  • Bag of salt (can be bought from any Slayer Master, other players, or the Grand Exchange) or an empty bucket to obtain a pile of salt in Sophanem
  • Bucket of sap (use a knife on an evergreen tree or a regular tree with the description "a commonly found tree" with a bucket in your inventory)
  • Full waterskin to give away (can be bought for 30 coins at Shantay pass)
  • Linen (Can be bought on The Grand Exchange or bought from Raetul in Sophanem for 30 coins during the quest)
  • Means to enter the desert. (Such as the Shantay pass, Desert amulet 2, Teleport tablets or scrolls, Fairy rings or the Pharaoh's sceptre)
Recommended
  • 50 Combat level
  • 35 Agility to jump over the pit in the pyramid (higher agility helps even more)
  • Waterskins for the desert heat
  • 1–2 antipoison or superantipoison potions
  • Energy potions (100% run energy helps with crossing the pit RNG.)
  • Nardah teleport
  • Armour and some food
  • Ghostspeak amulet for story comprehension (Klenter)
Enemies to defeat
  • Possessed Priest (level 91)
  • One of the level 75–81 guardians (randomly chosen):
    • Apmeken (level 75)—uses Magic
    • Crondis (level 75)—uses Magic
    • Scabaras (level 75)—uses Melee
    • Het (level 81)—uses Melee

(Such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Note: If you need to leave Sophanem at any point during the quest, there is a hole you can crawl through on the eastern wall. To get back in, enter the rocks on the east side of the Wanderer's tent. There is a bank in Nardah if needed.

Note: For pit jump: more run energy helps a lot (try to do it at 100%) as does more agility. At low run energy you are way more likely to fall in the pit.

Starting out[edit | edit source]

Items needed: 2 x Waterskin (4), tinderbox and a cat.
The quest's start point.
  • Talk to the Wanderer north-east of Sophanem (see picture) and ask why she has a problem with your cat. ( 2•1)…
    2Why? What's your problem with it?
    1Ok I'll get your supplies.
  • Talk to the Wanderer again to give her a tinderbox and waterskin(4). ( 4)…
    4Yes. I have them all here.
  • Touch the door of the pyramid where you wake up.

The first flashback[edit | edit source]

Items recommended: Several stamina potion or super energy and some food.
Solution

Warning: You cannot teleport out of this area! There are aggressive Level 84 Mummies scattered throughout the map, and Scarabs that can inflict poison (it is possible to run past the scarabs without taking damage or being poisoned by spam-clicking the minimap). If you need to leave you must walk back to the entrance and use the ladder.

  • Navigate by clicking the minimap to automatically avoid the traps.
  • Jump the pit (20% minimum energy required, 2 free hands help, more run energy also helps, as does agility).
  • Go west and open the door.
  • Click on the large golden bird to reset the puzzle until it lands on the solution shown in the image on this page. Then click the tiles indicated on the picture.

The sphinx[edit | edit source]

Items needed: A cat.
  • Drop your cat and talk to the Sphinx, ask for help. ( 1•1)…
    1I need help.
    1Okay, that sounds fair.
  • Riddle answer: 9. ( 2•1)…
    29.
    1Totally positive.
    (if you give the wrong answer your cat will disappear)
  • Talk to the High Priest to the south-west.

The second flashback[edit | edit source]

Items needed: A cat, combat equipment.
Items recommended: Several stamina potion or super energy and some food.
  • Return to the pyramid (right-click door and open) and jump the pit again to trigger the next flashback.
  • Open the western door (directly south of you) and take the canopic jar back (you can only pick up the correct one).
  • A level 75 or 81 enemy (see the guardians in the info box above) will appear, kill it and take the jar. (DON'T FORGET TO TAKE THE JAR AFTER KILLING THE ENEMY!)
  • Leave the room and jump across the pit.
  • Jump back across the pit.
  • Solve the western door puzzle and drop the jar where you found it.
  • Leave the room again and jump across the pit once more.
  • Exit the pyramid via the entrance ladder.

Preparing for the ceremony[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Bucket of sap, pile of salt or bag of salt, linen, willow logs.
  • Talk to the High Priest. ( 1)…
    1Sure, no problem.
  • Go to the house south of the church and talk to the Embalmer.
  • Talk to the Embalmer again to give him the linen, salt, and sap
    • If you don't have a linen, go north-east to the Spinning Wheel and talk to Raetul to buy linen for 30 coins.
    • If you need a pile of salt, it can be found by using an empty bucket on the pond north of Sophanem and then using the full bucket on the centre piece of the suntrap east of the Embalmer.
  • Go east and talk to the Carpenter. ( 2)…
    2Alright, I'll get the wood for you.
  • Talk to the Carpenter again and give him your willow logs.
  • Talk to the Carpenter once more to get the holy symbol.

The third flashback[edit | edit source]

Items needed: A cat, combat equipment.
Items recommended: Several stamina potion or super energy and some food.
  • Enter the pyramid (right click, open door).
  • Jump the gap again to trigger the 3rd flashback.
  • Enter the east door and use the holy/unholy symbol on any sarcophagus. Exit the room.
  • Jump back across the pit and enter the eastern room again.
  • Kill the level 91 Possessed Priest.
  • Talk to the High Priest.

The fourth flashback[edit | edit source]

  • Exit the pyramid.
  • Talk to the High Priest in the temple.

Quest complete!

Note: If you equip your catspeak amulet and then talk to your cat about being confused, you will unlock another cutscene! Talking with your cat again about being confused will tell you the story of the quest as it understands it. If asked again, your cat will refuse to explain it again and instead tells you to ask one of your adventuring buddies and the chat option will go away.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 2 Quest points
  • 4,500 Thieving experience
  • 4,000 Agility experience
  • 4,000 Woodcutting experience
  • Catspeak amulet
  • Access to the city of Sophanem
  • Unlock the carpet rides from Pollnivneach to Sophanem and Menaphos

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completing this quest is required for:

  • Ratcatchers
  • A Tail of Two Cats
  • Contact!
  • Rogue Trader
